reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 3 days at the Hotel d'Arlatan in Arles. The first two nights we were very happy with the accommodations. The room, though old, was comfortable. We liked the convenient location within the old town limits, close to many outdoor cafes and attractions of the city and within a 20 minute walk to the train station. We decided to spend a third night there as they had a room available although it required that we change rooms. The new room was uncomfortably hot even though it was supposed to be air conditioned. When we went to the desk to ask about the air conditioning we were scolded by the desk clerk who was on duty. She told us it was our fault for opening the window which caused the air conditioner not to work!!! Someone went up while we were out to dinner and attempted to fix the air conditioner but it really just didn't work well enough to cool the room. The first two days we were there a different woman was on duty at the desk and she couldn't have been nicer. The third day a new woman was there and she was very unpleasant. Besides the air conditioner incident she also refused to check us out that evening as we were leaving on a very early train and would be leaving before a clerk was on duty!!!!
reviews.title: Interesting and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: That said the hotel is very interesting with a Roman ruin beneath it which you can see through a glass plate in the floor. It had a lovely sitting room, pool area and court yard. We loved Arles with all its Roman history and Van Gogh connections. We also found a wonderful little bistro called Chez Nene & Bebe at impasse du Forum that we highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great hotel with stunning pool right in the centre of Arles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great hotel with loads of character, pool was fabulous, rooms were fairly spacious with good sized en-suite. Only a few seconds walk from Place de Forum right in the centre of town and yet very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Could Be Better for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However genereally felt that the management were not making the most of what is a characterful building in a stunning location. The reception staff were not very friendly or helpful - least positive experience out of four hotels on this trip. (Other staff eg night porters, bar staff were much friendlier.) Also the hotel information in room was so out of date it talked about Francs rather than Euros! The hotel had a lovely pool and courtyard area but felt that the most was not been made of this facility eg overturned tables, outdoor shower not working, uncared for flower arrangements
reviews.title: Great location, rooms overdue for renovation, lackadaisical service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: We had a snafu with a hotel we had booked in Avignon and had to find accommodations ASAP in the area, so we booked Hotel d'Arlatan per a travel guide recommendation and they were available for a family. Also, at the time of booking, they had a decent TA rating (it dropped while we were there and now we see why).
reviews.title: No WIFI despite advertising it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews on this site as basically correct. This is a very quaint hotel located in the historical centre of Arles.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel in centre of old Arles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a larger room (for an additional 20 Euro) and it was a good size, overlooking the courtyard, which we loved. Bed and pillows were clean but I'm sorry to say quite uncomfortable. Bathroom was a good size and also clean. The shower however was a little tricky to use as there was no shower screen meaning we got water everywhere!
reviews.title: Charming hotel, beautiful courtyard and pool in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was available on site for an additional 14 Euro and yes, as the other reviewers note, getting there is a little tricky given the narrow streets, but in our view this was half the fun!
reviews.title: Historic and eclectic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not try the Brekki, so cannot comment.
reviews.title: Charming but leave the car at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In our view this hotel was reasonable value and we enjoyed our stay here but if we were to return we would look elsewhere for something a little more 'special'. Good for a quick overnight stay (like us) but if i were staying longer I would suggest looking into other options.
reviews.title: Hotel with great ambience in the heart of Arles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely little hotel. The building is old and wonderful. The rooms were clean and of a decent size. To me, the star of the place was the lovely courtyard with a fountain, and where you can take the excellent continental breakfast. Also very neat are the roman ruins under the hotel - visible via a glass floor in the lobby.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is close to all your major Arlesian tourist attractions.
reviews.title: At the heart of Arles with a pool for a dip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's something rather nice about Arles. It attracts tons of tourists but doesn't get too flustered from the summer invasions, unlike some of it's neighbours. Our second visit to Arles brought us an evening with Cesária Évora at the Théâtre Antique and a reminiscent return to a tasty creperie 'Chez Mam Gaz' near the Arena, with a one-night stay at Hotel d'Arlatan (as our first choice Hotel La Calendal was fully booked). Initially we attempted to find the hotel garage by GPS but resorted to my partner heading off by foot for the receptionist's help! The streets are very narrow and busy with folks but thankfully an attendant at the hotel parks the car for guests.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a welcoming cooling building with courtyards, verandas, quiet décor and a sort of sleepiness that is very relaxing. The small swimming pool area was very peaceful and clean, and it was nice to take a cool dip under the hot sun. Our room was simple, clean and unfussy, but with nothing particularly special to point out. The bed suffered from very floppy soft pillows which I'm not so keen on.
reviews.title: Charm and History - Tranquil Setting in heart of Arles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: In my opinion it's overpriced compared to most of the places we stayed over the next 3 weeks and this is the only reason I would not recommend it to a friend.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night here and found the location to be great, the service (while we were there) to be good, but found the hotel to be generally just average. Small rooms, awkward bathrooms and kind of an uncomfortable bed. Not a bad place really, but just not a really good one. We left a pretty expensive book in the room and e-mailed several days later asking that it be mailed to us (at our expense) and never heard back from them. Kind of wierd, especially since the front desk was very nice while we were there. So I guess overall, I would probably go with the competitor also in the old part of town in the same price range.
reviews.title: Kind of a mixed bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where else could you stay that has a glass floor in the lobby that allows you to look down into the Roman ruins beneath your feet? We enjoyed the gracious public spaces and our charming room that looked down into the terrace. Breakfast was generous and had a wide selection. Our only quibble was the hotel's policy that forbid us to eat anything out on the terrace. We purchased a lovely picnic lunch at the Saturday market, but the hotel would not allow us to eat at one of the many tables on the terrace.
reviews.title: Wonderful atmosphere and a very convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel D'Arlatan sits in the midst of the old town of Arles. It is historic in its own right - a former private mansion built over a portion of the 1st Century Roman baths. The public areas - formal salon, dining room and bar - are impressive in size and decoration. But our room needed serious maintenance attention. Both bathtub and sink faucets were missing parts and not functioning; toilet leaked and recharged every 30 seconds; floor tiles were loose and spaces filled with debris; bed mattress was firm, but frame should have been replaced. Billed as a junior suite, it was small and cramped. Several new hotels to the south of the area (including a Best Western) were in better shape and much less expensive.
reviews.title: Formerly historic hotel needs work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights and booked this hotel on the basis that it was right in the middle of the old town and had a swimming pool. We were not disappointed with our choice although we were given a free room upgrade (not sure why) and so that may make us a bit biased. We did not take breakfast in the hotel as it was pricey and a 30 second stroll from the front door of the hotel takes you to Place Du Forum where you can buy the same thing for half the price. Driving and parking in Arles is a nightmare and if you have anything bigger than a Smart car you could find it rather stressful navigating the one-way system of cobbled alley ways. There is parking at the hotel and prices per day vary on the size of your car (from approx 12 to 14 euros). As we had a hire car we decided not to use the car park and abandoned the car just on the outskirts of the old town in a free space for three days. The Front Desk advised that our car would be quite safe and she was right. The swimming pool is fairly small and there is only room for about eight sun loungers so I can imagine it could get quite congested in high season. We were fine and shared the pool and deck with only two of three others on an afternoon post sightseeing. The salon, bar and restaurant areas are gorgeous and rather plush for a three start hotel. The bedrooms are quirky (as you would expect in a building of this age) but our bathroom was a bit tired and could do with being replaced. On one day our room had not been made up and so at 6pm we queried this with the Front Desk. They apologised profusely advising that the cleaning staff were new and rectified immediately. They also provided us with free drinks in the bar whilst we waited. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Superb location with a pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in hotel d'Arlatan mid-August in room 1B. The hotel location is great in the middle of the old city (althoug it is difficult to drive there, once you're in, you do not need the car anymore).
reviews.title: Mixed feelings: great location, gloomy room, so-so staff
